meanings.definition: A line or boundary where aquatic plants, such as seaweed, grow in a body of water.
meanings.sent1: The fishermen knew they were close to the weedline when they saw the thick growth of seaweed floating on the water.
meanings.sent2: The boat gently glided along the weedline, the seaweed swaying with the movement of the waves.
meanings.sent3: The ducks decided to have a race to see who could reach the weedline first, thinking it was the finish line.
meanings.sent4: The weedline in the lake seemed like a natural barrier, separating the calm water from the dense underwater forest.
meanings.sent5: As the sun set, the colors of the weedline reflected beautifully on the surface of the water.

meanings.definition: A line of vegetation, typically consisting of weeds, along the edge of a field or garden.
meanings.sent1: The farmer carefully trimmed the weedline along his garden to prevent the weeds from spreading.
meanings.sent2: Wildflowers bloomed along the weedline, adding a splash of color to the otherwise green landscape.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous rabbit thought the weedline was a secret hiding spot, not realizing it was visible from afar.
meanings.sent4: The weedline in the field looked like a fuzzy green ribbon winding its way through the crops.
meanings.sent5: Children loved playing near the weedline, imagining it was a magical border between two worlds.
